\ A tie happens when there are no further moves. In the case of a tie in a small board, that will count as a win for both sides in the larger game.

\ Welcome to Scraggle!!!

 The GamePlay:

 Scraggle is a word game with an unusual twist on the famous games of word scrambles; Boggle and Scrabble.


The game is played on a square board of letter tiles (9 grids of 3*3 grid).


The game is played in two phases and against a timer of 90 seconds each.


In Phase 1, you can form words from any adjoining letters, including diagonals belonging to the same grid only. If there is no correct word from at least two grids, the game will be over and you shall not proceed to Phase 2.


In Phase 2, you can form words by selecting one letter from each available grid. You can repeat different letters from the same grid but not consecutively.


When forming a word, choose letters by tapping individual adjoining letters in sequence. Submit the finished word by touching the "Submit" button.


If you want to start over for a particular grid/word or select a new word altogether, touch the "Submit" button.


You cannot submit the same word more than once during the entire duration of the game.



Scoring and Time:


Your current score is shown at the top right corner of the screen and your remaining time appears at the top left corner.


Submitting a valid word increases the score.


Words may be between 3 to 9 letters long during Phase 1. During Phase 2, a word should be minimum of 3 letters long.

\ Welcome to Two Player Word Game!!!

 The GamePlay:

 First you need to register so that you can find an available opponent and start playing. Next step is to send a play request to an available player from the list displayed. Once the opponent accepts the play request, the game starts.


The player who sends the request gets the first chance. Once the first word is submitted by the player, the turn goes to the opponent. You will not be able to submit another word unless it is your turn again.


Your turn will again come when the opponent submits a word or when he passes it to you. A pass can be done by shaking the phone.
If either of the player quits the game, then the game is over.
